text:
Little oasis away from the Main Street of Sanur with only about 6-8 rooms so very personal service. About 10 minutes walk from main restaurants, shops and beach. Room had everything we needed with small terrace/seating area with loungers, where you also have your breakfast. Staff were excellent and couldn’t do enough for you always checking if you needed anything. We had a complimentary massage with our package and this was very good. 
A couple of points worth noting, there are only two double loungers in the sun by the pool, so this makes sunbathing limited. But you’ve got the whole of Sanur beach for this!  Also the walk to restaurants at night is quite dark and can look a bit daunting, but is perfectly safe.
title: Little oasis

text: We stayed at Karmagali for 3 nights. We had a lovely relaxing stay in a small, boutique hotel. Best rates and extras included are when you book direct. We had our airport transfer included and a 30 minute massage per person for our stay (included when you book direct and stay 3 nights or more). Breakfast was delicious and served to our terrace outside our room each morning which was lovely. The pool is small but perfect for the hotel size. The give great attention to detail at this hotel and we couldn't fault anything. The bed was super comfy and the shower excellent. If we were to make one recommendation it would be for there to be mosquito nets over the bed (though they do provide repellant spray) as we would have liked to have that extra coverage! The complex is secure as there is always some on duty day and night. We also had lunch at the hotel which was cooked fresh and was delicious. There are other restaurants etc 10 minutes away... but this hotel is not located on the beach or very near to it (it's 10-15 mins away). Just worth nothing!
title: A peaceful stay

text:
My husband and I, stayed at this Retreat in March of this year for 5 nights. We loved it. We were traveling with another couple so when we booked Frederic suggested we book the 2 bedroom Bungalow so we did. So glad we did. It was amazing, it is a great setup with a bedroom and en suite ( en suite is an understatement)  on either side which both lock up and a common area in between both rooms where we could sit and enjoy breakfast and other meals together. The common area has a full size fridge, a dining suite and a full size lounge area. We felt a bit spoilt in here as it was like the Royal Palace, all the rooms were lovely but our room was at the back of the property overlooking the pool.
 
The property is located in the back streets where we got to experience the real Balinese life. It is a 15 minute walk to the beach and an 8 minute walk to the main street, the only thing I would warn about is to be careful walking the back streets in the night as it isn't very well lit.

Everything about this retreat is luxurious, from the minute you are greeted at the front gate by one of the butlers, Anga or Putu you are made to feel at home. All of the staff were so lovely and helpful, they couldn't do enough for us, the service was the best.

I was unlucky enough to fall sick while we were there and Magali , the other owner arranged for a doctor to come to the hotel, I was so happy that she could help me as I was back on my feet by the next day.

I really enjoyed all of the meals that I had from the kitchen. Everything was presented lovely. Steve our friend that was with us is a chef and he had a tour of the kitchen and couldn't believe how clean and well presented everything was.

Youlee ( I think that is how it is spelt ) has magic hands. I wish we had more time for more massages. Thank you Youlee.

We took a day trip to Nusa Lembongan, that was arranged for us by Anga. Thank you Anga for all of your help. 

We all enjoyed our 5 days at Karmagali Boutique Suites. Thank you to all the staff and especially thanks to the lovely couple Frederic and Magali for having the inspiration the create such a beautiful retreat in paradise. I really can't say enough about the place
title: Wow!!

text:
I booked for one night, came back for a second and wish I could have stayed longer. 
Everything is perfect. Tucked away a short but pleasant 10-15 min stroll from the Main Street. I felt safe walking as a solo female at night. 
The gardens surrounding the pool are stunning and offer a bit of privacy as you sit on your veranda eating breakfast or enjoying the tranquility. 
Welcome snacks and breakfast were absolutely delicious. I also had Nasi Goreng for lunch which was well priced. 

The room was stunning. Clean and well maintained with everything you need. The bed was comfortable with a mosquito net.  The bathroom has an outdoor feel with a beautiful garden. 

Karmagali has their own brand of toiletries which were beautiful to use - the insect repellent was a handy addition.  Rather than the small, single use containers many places use for their toiletries, Karmagali supply larger bottles which can be refilled/reused.  Another eco friendly aspect was the drinking water supplied in a jug to refill your water bottle, rather than the daily bottles of water that end up as plastic pollution. 

The staff made my stay at Karmagali such a positive experience. Nothing was ever too much trouble. Special mention to Putu and Angaa who were so lovely and went out of their way to ensure I had everything I needed. 

I will definitely come back to Karmagali. It is a beautiful piece of paradise hidden in Sanur
title: A hidden paradise

text:
We stayed at karmagali for 3 nights at the end of a scuba liveaboard in Komodo.   Booking with owner Frederick was super easy and pleasant.  There were three of us and we took the two bedroom villa in this boutique hotel.  

What’s left us with the most memorable impression is the friendliness, from the owner Frederick, and his wife,  to the Butler Engga and the rest of the staff and the people/neighbors around the area.  Everyone has a smile!  The staff are knowledgeable and accommodating.   Sanur is a much less crowded area compared to Ubud.  

The rooms are clean and well appointed.  Air-condition works well.  The only problem is mosquitos.  They are everywhere in the bathrooms since the windows do not have a screen.  Many mosquitoes come into the bedroom and you can hear them buzzing around all night.  

Breakfast were great.  You can choose a meal of your own flavor: Balinese, French, continental, vegetarian or gluten free.  Always plenty of fresh fruits with breakfast.  

After breakfast, Frederick, or Engga would come by and help us plan the day, with suggestions of destinations, arrangement of scooters for one day, and a car with a driver for the second day.  We also walked to the beaches every evening and enjoyed cocktails, drinks at one of the many establishments on the beach.  

There is good printed information in binders in the room, and an e-brochures which were email to us.  We had plenty to do during the 3- nights stay.  We loved Sanur area.  Much less traffic and less crowded than Ubud which was an disappointment.  We were in Ubud 8 years ago and really loved it.  But now, it’s overwhelmed by the none-stop traffic, noise, and crowed, narrow, sidewalks full of potholes.  Sanur still maintains the old Balinese charm that we loved.  

Thanks Karmagali! Highly recommended!
title: Pleasant surprise

text: Excellent service and beautiful setting.  Karmagali is only a short walk from the main drag in Sanur, and only a bit further to the beach. The opportunity to take advantage of the bicycles on loan was a great feature!  The pool is very clean and just the right temperature and the breakfast is fresh and more than enough!  Only piece of advice - the mosquito repellent provided in the room smells quite nice but doesn't really repel mosquitos.  If you're worried about them, bring your own!
title: Great attention to detail - true luxury

text:
We stayed at Karmagali Suites on the last days of our Bali trip. What an amazing way to closure a fantastic visit to one of the most charming places in the world!
The never-ending pool greeted us upon arrival, everything about the decor was as tasteful and refined as we had expected, but it was the absolutely luxurious attention of the very attentive and friendly personnel that really made us fall in love with this place.
Lovely breakfast with plenty of options, and homemade exotic jam, crêpes, jamu shot. Plenty of quantity and quality.
The very nice owners gave us fantastic tips for eating out, and anyway Sanur has a lot to offer, it is a great compromise between a modern, international setting - easy for tourists - and authentic, smiling and charming Balinese neighbours.
Worth mentioning would also be the massages and care packages provided at the hotel by a highly professional masseuse. If you don't indulge in them I guarantee you will regret it once you get back home.
All in all, we didn't just love being there and wish we'll return soon, we would love to actually live there!
title: Little piece of paradise

text:
We stayed here for 3 nights. The room was simply beautiful, and the bathroom was stunning. The finishes were very high end, and the layout was really thoughtful - while all of the half dozen rooms looked out on the pool, it all felt extremely private and quiet. The breakfast was amazing!

The staff and owners were extremely welcoming and helpful. I might almost say too helpful - I had the impression there were staff hovering at times, and knocking on our door to bring us cookies while we were napping, etc. I would have preferred something a little more hands off. They provided us with complimentary bikes to explore, which was really nice.

There are plenty of restaurants in the vicinity, and it's about a 10 minute walk to the beach.
title: Very nice

text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel with lovely villas around a great pool (the longest pool we had in any of the places we stayed in Bali). The owner, Frederic is super helpful and gave us tips for a trip to nusa lembongan (which was great - beautiful beaches and excellent snorkelling!) Putu and the rest of his team were also great and provided us with lots of information. The room was clean and nicely decorated and the bathroom was huge. We spent one day just relaxing by the pool and loved it. Free refreshments were given to us by the hotel staff by the pool and the biscuits and cakes we had each night left in our room were a nice surprise. We had a 30minute free welcome massage each which was the best massage we had in Bali!! Breakfast was also plentiful, fresh fruits, juices and we loved the egg pancake (other egg options were also available). Great for easy access to the airport, sanur beach and nusa lembongan. Free bikes available.

text:
Location: 8 min walk from the main road, 15 from the beach. There are free bikes though. The surroundings are beautiful, there's a swimming pool in the middle of the garden. Yes there may be a bit of noise in the morning from the street, but we were used to it travelling through the country.

Rooms: beautiful and spacious, especially the bathroom. All amenities necessary. The only minus was very weak light (difficult to read) and poor Wi-Fi. Worked better outside the room though. Each of the small "bungalows" has an area where you can relax and eat your breakfast.

Breakfast: delicious. You can choose between different options and they are all big and tasty. Pineapple jam - my favourite. There were also cookies in the afternoon and the evening, the only problem was that, since we were out during the day, they were taken away before we managed to taste them :(

Staff: no suprise here, as everywhere in Indonesia people are super nice and friendly.
title: A bit of luxury inside a city

text:
We stayed at Karmagali for a week in May. We loved the property, everything about it is beautiful. Yet there's stills so much potential to step it up a notch.

Initially we were shocked by the fact that the rooms aren't soundproof because of its beautiful roof. I guess we got unlucky on our first day with a baby crying all night in the house in the village behind us. The moment we accepted that this is just a 'Balinese soundtrack" and that the sounds of chickens, motorcycles, kids, ceremonies are part of the experience it didn't bother us anymore. 

The owners are lovely, staff is fabulous and super kind! Thank you for that.

Breakfast is good, however we didn't enjoy the coffee nor the super hard croisants, but that's personal taste. Cakes were lovely!

As for improvement, we'd suggest making more storage space. Things arent very practical inside the rooms. Staying for a week with 4 suitcases in a very tiny room (yes beware the rooms are smaller than you expect isn't very practical.

We would've loved a chair in the room (they were kind enough to bring us one but this should be standard) more clothes hangers would've been ideal (again they brought us some). Even some sort of hooks on the wall wouldve been helpful. 

The safe inside the room wasn't pinned down to any wall either. So you could just pick up the entire box and walk away with your valuables. Not sure this was ideal either. The property has 24 hr security, but i'd still like that peace of mind of knowing my safe can't be stolen.

All in all we loved Karmagali, but simply missed the finishing touches to make it even better. We would come again and recommend it to friends, but only for a few days and with less luggage. Price quality I'd say it's a bit on the high end.

Would I recommend it for families with kids? Definitely not!
title: Lovely property with a natural "Balinese soundtrack"

text:
I know we are all entitled to our opinions but I am totally mystified by a recent review "Most difficult review to write" who gave this wonderful place an average rating, which is totally undeserved. Karmagali is a guest house with 5 suites and the owners bungalow and looks exactly as it seems in the photographs. The room was more than fine and had a very spacious bathroom and we liked the outside space overlooking the pool as it was very private. Unlike the other guest reviewer who must have had super large suit cases, we were able to store them out of the way under the sofa without any problem, although there was also plenty of room in the wardrobe.

All the staff were brilliant, very friendly and helpful as was Magali, the owner, who we spoke to every morning at breakfast. The other reviewer complained about the noise and incredulously moaned that the private area was small, dark and hot. Perhaps they should have researched temperatures in Bali at this time of year before booking the holiday. Yes it was hot but there is a wall mounted outside fan and when it got dark we turned the lights on and there was plenty of space for the two of us. As for noise, I can only say that with the exception of Sidemen, which is in the middle of the rice fields, we found everywhere (Seminyak & Ubud) quite noisy due to the hustle and bustle of the surrounding environment.

We booked this place because it is small and private and believe me the photos do absolute justice to the property. I'm amazed that anyone could find fault with this property if they had properly researched and absorbed the information on the Karmagali website. For us it was the perfect place to stay on our final four nights in Bali before heading home. If you read this then ignore the undeserved average review and read what everyone else says about this lovely place. And finally, the breakfast are really good too !!
title: Absolutely loved it and would definitely return.

On behalf of karmagali suite family,I  would like to say thank you for taking your time to review us,  and we will look forward for your next holiday in Bali, and definitely it is our pleasure too to serve on your next booking with us.

text: I am writing reviews after every Bali trip, for hotels, restaurants and things to do, and for me this is one of the most difficult reviews to write. We ended in Sanur, and Karmagali was the most expensive hotel of our trip, so then you expect something really special. But when we arrived, we were not impressed, for us it had no 'wow' factor. Maybe because the check in was a bit rushed, we were told how everything worked in the room, but it felt more professional than friendly. The owner was so busy all the time, running around the property. On the website the rooms and the hotel grounds looked bigger, for us it felt so cramped and small. The private area near the room was so small, dark and hot! In the room there was no space to lay down your suitcase, we put them in the bathroom. Maybe if you have a look at my other hotels, you understand what I mean. Here you cannot walk around, as you don't want to be in the face of other guests, and there is nothing to walk to. We love large gardens, big rooms, superfriendly Balinese staff, maybe I made a mistake by booking Karmagali....And then the noise...Frangipani and Timor room are really very close to local houses, you hear children cry and people talk loudly in the early morning and there is also traffic noise. There were some good things though, one was the delicious French breakfast, the best of our trip. And we liked the beanbags and the free bikes too. But sorry, this place was not our cup of tea....
title: Most difficult review to write

owner_response.text:
Dear Sylvia, First of all we are sorry if Karmagali did not respond to your expectations. You have booked the Frangipani and Timor suites, but you only used the salon of Timor which is designed for only 2 guests. During our exchanges before your booking, we advised you rather to reserve the Rama&Sita and Garuda suites which are designed for families and friends as the outdoor lounges are joined and can be moved in a single large living room (the one we show you by video skype), but little bit more expansive. This summer we will also opening a 2 bedrooms bungalow (130m2 suface)  specially dedicated to this effect. In Bali, specially in April-May between the rainy and windy season it can be hot outside and that’s why each outdoor lounge is equipped with a fan. The layout of the rooms is designed for the luggage to be recorded in the 18m2 bathroom  which is equipped with a large wardrobe. Karmagali is located in the city center, but away from the main street and in an area where expat’s villas, hotels and locals are blended. It is also what makes the charm of our neighbourhood because we can actually see how the daily life of the Balinese is performed by rituals and ceremonies. As in all the countries of the world the inhabitants will work in the morning and the street animates for a few hours… As for our staff, they are very attentive to do well but fiew of them are not easy with English talking… They still nice people. To me, as every morning I went to see you to check if everything was okay and discuss your program of the day. Please excuse me if I am not well enough to see you at the end of the day and if I was busy during the day ... Indeed, as I had explained to you on your arrival my husband had to leave in France urgently for family reasons which explains my overactivity of the moment. It is primoridal for us that our guests feel good and do not miss anything and it takes a little time sometimes;). Agus our new butler is available in order to meet the expectations of our guests especially when sometimes we have to be out during the day...
Regards
The owner

text:
(1) Location 

Karmagali Suites is around a half an hour drive from the international airport. By using Grab, we only paid 50,000 Ruppiah (with an additional toll of 11,000 Ruppiah if you wish to take the quicker route). Karmagali Suites is a little deep in from the main street but that shouldn't be an issue because it takes around 5-10 minutes (really dependent on the weather) to walk out to the main street to get your fix of local food / massage etc. 

Given that we are always on the hunt for good food, we appreciated that one of the maps provided in the room was a food map- where they pointed out the recommendations for food. 

(2) Room

We booked the Frangipani Suite. The room was a good size, the pillows were comfortable and the greenery around was simply therapeutic. There were plenty of TV channels to choose from as well.

Although the room was closest to the street, it didn't really bother me since the noise wasn't loud, but if you are bothered, there are earplugs provided in the toilet.

(3) Toilet 

The toilet was nothing like I have seen before- it was spacious and boasts of nature elements. The soap and body gel smelt sweet and refreshing. For those who love rain showers, you have got it here.

(4) Breakfast

Breakfast was personalised. There is a menu in the room, containing breakfast items, lunch / dinner items, drinks and desserts. Breakfast was part of the room price. We were served breakfast at the area outside our room. Minus the pesky houseflies and the occasional mosquito, it was a delight to be sitting below strips of bamboo and enjoying a delicious breakfast.

You could choose from the French, Continental or Indonesian menu. We opted from the French Menu, which came with a platter of fresh fruits, fresh juice, coffee / tea and a selection of French pastries (coupled with jam / butter). The French pastries included croissant, crepe, brioche and lemon cake (choose any 3). We enjoyed the lemon cake and crepe.

(5) Amenities 

There is a swimming pool shared by the five suites. During the time we were around, we didn't see anyone use the pool but it was indeed inviting. Wifi was strong. They also provide laundry services for an extremely reasonable rate.

(6) Service 

Service was exceptional. From the owners to the staff, each of them were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping also made the room spick and span.
title: What a relaxing and enjoyable stay

text:
We stayed from Boxing day 2015 to 2nd Jan 2016.. Really plush room, quality finish, carved fixtures in the bathroom and ice cool air-con. The pool out-front 

Breakfast is served daily on your private area outside of your room, with a secluded recess away from other guests so you can eat breakfast in privacy. 

Finding the hotel by yourself would require be a bit a back street experience in the area, but once your got your bearings needing a taxi to find it at first, but its actually quite nice to be back about 15 mins from the beach and the Bali pushy vendors.. An easy walk to the beach can be done night and day,just watch out for walking in the street as anywhere in Bali has mopeds back and forward which can be dangerous if your not watching where you are going.

There are very friendly staff, and you can eat local food on site, with beer and wine all at really good prices., and the owner is french pastry chef, so the food is excellent with pastries that you just have to experience. The prices of the food is at local rates, and really in-expensive. Next door there is a small local food place where me and my son had a local fare Nasi Goreng, and a beer each and the bill was $10 AUD total.. crazy cheap.

The owner will arrange a car and drive for the whole day for you for about $60 AUD, which is just typical of the value of Bali.. took us all round temples etc, and waited for us every where we went. We also used the driver to get back the airport (which cost is 1/3 of the local taxi rate we were charged to get to the hotel on the way there)..

Overall, a very nice hotel, really good break and a lovely nine day experience. Can recommend the place if you don't like a hotel which has too many guests.. There are only 5 rooms so max capacity is about 10 people!
title: Tranquil intimate boutique hotel.

text:
The location was great, a few mins from the main street so quiet but close enough to all restaurants, bars and the beach. The swimming pool was amazing, clean. 
The management was always on site to make sure that everything was going ok, They can provide you with loads of advice on the city and stuff to visit. Their food was amazing. Cakes are a must try! The rooms are spacious and the beds are very comfortable. The management put a lot of thought on attention to detail. I will definitely stay there again when coming to Bali. Ideal place to stay upon arrival in Bali and before departing.
title: Ideal place to stay in Sanur, quiet place but close to the beach. Comfortable and great management

text:
Everything you have read before this review is true.  Lovely accommodation, super beds and bathrooms.  Beautiful choice on the breakfast menu with the option of ordering coffee and cakes during the day. Complimentary ginger water and nibbles during the day.

Staff are superb, nothing is too much trouble and they are always on hand whilst never intrusive.  Frederic and Magali, the owners, have done a wonderful job.  They help out with any questions one may have and are available for a chat daily whilst also respecting your privacy.

There is a mini fridge in the rooms with a supply of soft drinks, water and beer, all for a small charge.  

The local Warung Dead Fish is recommended for a light lunch and there is a lovely little pizza place, Papa Pizza, just a little further on, taking a right at the crossroads.  

I have no hesitation in recommending Karmagali Suites as your accommodation in Sanur. Ideal for couples.
title: Beautiful and tranquil place to stay

text: I cannot rave about this place enough....we are now in our 3rd accommodation in Bali and it is by far our favourite and best one, sadly we compare everything to 'Karmagali'.  The hosts were friendly and helpful without being intrusive. Staff were outstanding and so helpful when a driver didn't turn up for us one day on time (that we had organised).  Bikes supplied are excellent quality, we used them on 2 mornings and they were quickly brought out at 7.30am when we asked for them. Rooms are beautiful, large and so is the bathroom.  Beds and pillows super comfy.  We loved the outdoor lounge area with your own bean bag lounges only steps from the fantastic pool which is very big for only 5 rooms in whole complex.  Breakfast is served in your own dining area when you want.  Drinks are served also anytime with complimentary nibbles that were amazing.  I am hesitant writing this for fear it will be discovered....  Location only 10min walk from Main Street via back alleys.  We will be back!
title: Excellent B&B, a hidden gem

text:
Real paradise in Bali. Frédéric and Magali and the rest of the wonderful staff made sure me and my husband felt very welcomed, safe and comfortable from the very first second of our stay.

The room and the amazing bathroom were even more beautiful than the amazing pictures, full with detailed decoration and always very clean. The bed was the most comfortable bed, we have ever slept outside our home. The delicious homemade breakfast was an amazing start of the day and relaxing in the nice cozy pool in the beautiful garden was the perfect finish of the day. This villa is perfectly located, extremely convenient with a short walk to the beach with many great restaurant options.

We were overwhelmed by the hospitability and the friendliness of the entire staff in the villa.
You truly feel at home while staying here. A definitely “must stay” in Bali!

We can not wait to come back and are pleased we met Frédéric and Magali and stayed in Karmagali.
title: Must Stay in Bali

text: With only 5 suites, this is the perfect location for couples who want to enjoy pure relaxation with their own dining area, lounging area and a lovely pool. Magali and Fred are lovely owners who make you feel very welcome. Breakfast is great with a good choice and the ginger water they offer is very refreshing each day. It's based in a quieter street away from the main strip which is nice as you can take a relaxed stroll each night to the strip to have dinner - we recommend little bird, lilla warung and Nu lazer for great live music and food. Overall we were very satisfied by our decision to stay here :)
title: The perfect relaxing break

text:
We stayed at Karmagali Suites for 1 week and we absolutely loved every minute of it. The couple, Fred & Magali were just so friendly and welcoming. They always made sure that we were taken care of and happy. The breakfast was delicious, especially the home made bread and jams - yum. 

We loved the property - it looked exactly like in the photos... and even better. The rooms were clean and spacious... and the decoration was gorgeous. Absolutely loved the space in the bathroom. And the wifi was excellent - I was able to get work done in no time because the wifi worked very well. 

The location is also convenient - it is only 10-15 minutes walk away from the main strip of Sanur. It was nice and quite, away from any hustle and bustle. We would definitely highly recommend staying here without a doubt. Will be back!!
title: Absolutely Loved Our Stay!

text: We had three nights at this lovely place a couple of weeks ago - friendly and helpful owners and staff, most comfortable bed and luxurious room, breakfast included and served outside your room on a private patio, huge bathroom, quiet, relaxing environment and pool, free good quality bicycles that we very much enjoyed cycling along the beachfront (which is about 15 mins walk away or a few mins by scooter or taxi from this property)  - we didn't want to leave! However before we did Frederic gave us great tips for our next destination Nusa Lembongan - recommend for a relaxing stay in Sanur!
title: Fabulous stay in stay in Sanur

text: When we made reservation back in January, this accommodation had only 9 reviews since they opened up only in December. I had a gut feeling from those reviews that it will be the right choice and our stay exceeded all our expectations. This is a boutique place, which has only 5 rooms and owner's house, all located around the swimming pool. Location is very quite, the only sounds you hear in the morning are dogs and cocks:) Our room (Rama & Sita suite) was very comfortable and had the most spacious bathroom that I have ever seen. Bed and pillows very extremely comfortable. Breakfast for every room's guests is served in separate lounge rooms next to the pool and you can choose from 3 options: Indonesian (nasi goreng (fried rice) or mie goreng (fried noodles), French (amazing pastries with selection of home-made jams) and Continental (toasts with egg and bacon or muesli with home-made yogurt). All options also include coffee/tea, fresh fruit platter and fresh juice. What a pleasure for eyes and stomach! Our hosts Magalie and Frédéric made our stay very comfortable; they answered all questions and suggested trips that we could make based on our interests. We ordered 4 trips via them and even had our favorite driver Wayan taking care of us. We wanted to see the best beaches, so Magalie suggested to go to Karma Beach (private club) and was very kind to share her membership card, which provides free entrance and discount on food and drinks. Karma beach experience was exclusive, we came back twice! We also went snorkeling, which again was great experience. I truly recommend Karmagali Suites and when I come back, it will be my number one choice!
title: Paradise in Sanur!

text: Cannot fault Karmagali if you are looking for a smaller, quieter, more personalized space to enjoy your time in Sanur. 15 min walk or very quick bike/scooter ride into the Main Street or the beach. Bicycles supplied free, scooter hire organized for 50,000 rupiah or $5 aud per day. Breakfast is lovely - good coffee! Other menu items are delicious and reasonably priced. Staff are very friendly. The owners live on site and ensure you have everything you need looked after. We had a day trip organized by them to visit some local sites they had suggested which was awesome! Even organized flowers with my partner for my birthday. We've had a great stay at Karmagali!
title: Really personalized service! Bed and breakfast feel.

text: Karmargarli is just WOW! The room, the pool, the service, the setting, the food, absolutely beautiful place for a couple to stay. The breakfast was cooked and presented beautifully. A short walk to main part of town for shopping and restaurants, a bit further to beach. Already planning my next trip to Bali and will be definitely staying at Karmagarli.
title: Hard to beat

text:
I chose this place to rest for a few days before flying back home after dragging my mum across the region and I can recommend it wholeheartedly!
We booked on the morning of our arrival and by the time we got there, everything was prepared for an early check in. The hosts and staff were most welcoming and never out of reach to help out with anything we might need –be it recommendations for shopping, a massage or lunch in the middle of the day (the food was exquisite, especially the pastry…)
We had booked the two slightly larger joint suites on the right hand side, which together with the private seating areas outside that could be combined offered a luxuriously large space.
The rooms and the entire estate is absolutely luxurious: spacious rooms, perfectly equipped, beautifully designed and decorated with a lot of style and love.
Still, the pool deserves a particular recommendation – the perfect place to start and end the day.
If you spend time in Sanur, this is a wonderful place to go!

text: This place was a piece of heaven! The location was great and room and common areas was very clean and stylish. The place is even lovely than pictures can tell you. All staff and especially the host couple were very friendly and helpful. We got good tips from them for dinner places and things to do around Sanur. Free bicycle hire was nice bonus! We especially recommend this place everyone! Hopefully someday I will return here :-)
title: ”A piece of heaven!”

text:
I stayed at Karmagali for 2 nights, it was the best place I have stayed in Bali. Karmagali opened only few weeks ago so everything is brand new. Modern & simply stunning furnitures (in a bali style) and the deco has all the facilities you would expect from a luxury boutique guesthouse . Spacious suites and very comfortable bed.The owners Magalie and Fred are wonderful. As soon as I landed in Bali they made my stay unforgettable. Private driver picked me up at the airport. At the checkin the owners sat down with me and my parents and ask us what was our expectations and our plans during our stay. They have very strong knowledge abt Bali and they take the time and the pleasure to recommend us tours, restaurants and all the spectacular places to see in Bali.  They have very hepful books that inform you abt all the services they offert. Their day tours with their driver Madé is a must to do ! The driver is awesome and very good value quality/price.
The experience at Karmagali is very different from the impersonal experience you can get in big hotel. Peaceful and intimate atmosphere, Only 5 rooms so no crowd ! 
Everything is hand made ( soap, shampoo, food...) and Magalie is a terrific chef ! 
Outstanding staff and service so thank you Magalie and Fred for your kindness. 
Tips: book the room through their website, price is more attractive.
title: Calm, restful and sublimely lovely boutique Guesthouse

Magali and Frédéric.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We are not long back from a wonderful stay at the Karmagali Suites in Sanur. This is a really beautiful property which is run by a fantastic French couple and their team of staff who will do their upmost to make you feel at home and to make sure your stay is a special one. 

The place is not long open so it is immaculate but you wouldn't know it was so new as the property is of the highest standard and run like a well established property. 

The room that we stayed in (Naga) was stunning with no expense spared which made for a great nights sleep, also the air con was nice and powerful which really helped on the humid nights.

The other great points are the breakfasts which are really tasty and varied and also the pool is incredible and you can have a proper swim in it. 

The property is located about a 10 minute walk from the main drag but it is a nice walk along a cycle/ scooter path where the people always say hello, there are also some great restaurants close by.

An amazing stay and I foresee this place being one of the top spots in Sanur in the near future.
title: Amazing accommodation in Sanur

text:
We spent a long time searching for somewhere to finish our holiday that was fairly close to the airport. As we'd never spent time in Sanur before, we decided to give Karmagali Suites a go for our last few days. And what a choice it turned out to be!

Located on one of the peaceful backstreets of Sanur, yet only a short walk to the main street and the beach. A perfect place to enjoy the peace and tranquility of this unique resort.

The owners, Frederic and Magali, are passionate about this place which they meticulously designed and built themselves. A boutique resort of only 5 rooms, each one is really inviting. Comfortable beds; decor and furnishings totally in keeping with the theme of the place.  Step outside the floor to ceiling glass of the front door and jump straight into the 20-metre long pool.     

The level of service is impeccable, the staff really attentive and helpful. The food on the menu is delicious. And you just can't ignore all the French pastries on offer (Magali is a trained pastry chef).

All in all a fantastic place to stay, and such excellent value for money. You really can't go wrong.....  Thanks Frederic, Magali, Kadek and the rest of the hard working team.
title: Great Place, Great Choice

text:
We originally booked to stay at a large resort in Sanur but we cancelled our booking and chose to stay at Karmagali instead once I found it on here and on Facebook. We're so happy we did! The hosts are genuinely interested in making your holiday amazing, whether you're there for 1 night or 8 as we were. The vibe is relaxed, attentive staff, beautiful pool, delicious food and you must try the French pastries. The suite was spacious enough for us with our teenage son. He's 6ft 4 inches tall and his bed was comfortable and large enough for him so you should be fine if you need to stay in a suite for 3 adults as we did. Our bed was luxurious. The bathroom was beautiful. Ice cold air con for hot Bali days and nights was divine.
It's a 10 minute walk to the beach past bars, shops, restaurants. We hired a driver for the day and saw temples and Ubud. I highly recommend you doing the same. We're already planning another Balinese vacation and we only landed home this morning. If you are looking for luxury accommodation with excellent service and loving heartfelt attention to detail then you should book to stay at Karmagali. Thank you to everyone there for making our first trip to Bali a truly magical experience. Sending you all my love from Cairns x merci beaucoup from Jane, David and Jake x
title: So happy we chose to stay here!

Magali and Frédéric

A very beautiful setup that provides a private, pampering and luxurious experience with a personal touch! Stayed at the Naga suite for four nights, i love the whole design with space, light and green coming together, giving a feel of serenity.

Swimming pool is right at the doorstep and a nice terrace for lounging and having breakfast. One can enjoy the whole day relaxing, chilling, reading, swimming...

Breakfast is always scrumptious! Mixed fruits, juice, eggs and toast or home-baked brioche with tea or coffee, up to the guest's liking. Magali bakes awesome! Definitely live up to the famous french patisserie name.

Location of the place is also convenient to walk to the main streets of restaurants and shops or to Sanur's beach (10 to 15mins). 

Yes, i will definitely be back for the delightful experience!

text:
I stayed at the Karmigali Boutique Suites for one night last week, and I so wish I could have stayed longer. 

I had such a warm, and friendly welcome by the staff, and I received a delicious and refreshing juice, as well as delicious pastries.

The suite itself was absolutely beautiful, clean, and spacious. The bed was so comfortable, and the air conditioning was perfect, meaning I got the best nights sleep. The bathroom was so big, with lovely products to use by the sink and in the massive shower.

There was plenty of choice for breakfast, and it was served on my private terrace. Everything was delicious that I ate!

Although my time there was brief, I managed to find time to have a much needed cool off swim in the pool, which was really clean, the perfect temperature and plenty big enough for a good swim.

The staff also helped arrange my transport to the airport for the following day. I would highly recommend staying here, and would definitely stay here again if I return to Bali.
title: Fabulous...only wish I could have stayed longer!

text:
This hotel is truly a tiny oasis in the middle of Sanur. The pictures you see are very accurate. Upon check in you’re greeted with cakes and juice, even in a downpour! Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The bathroom isn’t able to be air conditioned, but the room is, albeit not as cool as we would have liked, but that’s just a personal preference and we were still comfortable. The staff is BEYOND COMPARE. Every single worker at Karmagali is there for you no matter what time of day or night. 

We only had one meal there, but our breakfast was great, served on our private patio overlooking the pool. Afternoon tea is also provided free of charge most days. 

We did take advantage of the spa service in the form of massages. Also a wonderful experience. 

The staff is able to arrange a driver or a cab for you if needed. Our driver who took us to Uluwatu was fantastic. 

The pool is immaculate and so beautiful I could have spent a whole weeks just in the pool. 

Now for the cons. The hotel is located in a mixed use area, there are residences on both sides with children that are up with the sun. Sleeping in was not an option and a bit disappointing considering it’s “adults only”. And that bring me to the second con, for our last two nights there was a family with two kids. The main selling point for us going to Karmagali was adults only. That is apparently not the case. There’s also quite a bit of street noise very early.
title: Beautiful and close to so many fun spots

owner_response.text:
Dear Keri,

I'm very happy that you enjoyed many parts of Karmagali.

Staff will be pleased to read your comments (they truly are!)

I'm really concerned about your experience with "Adult only" mention... You're absolutely right and I would like to apologise and give some explanations; teens (16 and 10 years old girls) and parents are family came to visit us and both have been briefed about quietness of area. I'm sorry for any inconvenience it occurred.

We are looking forward to having you in Karmagali again!

F.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
An oasis amongst the back lanes of Sanur, you have a wonderful visual as you arrive through the carved wooden doors stepping into this rectangular central pool surrounded by palms and shrubs which are privacy screens for the 6 suites making up the courtyard. There are 2 double sun beds at the shallow end near the entrance which we took full advantage of. Our de-luxe( mid range) suite was perfect for our needs, & had a terrace under a lovely thatched roof. We had 2 comfortable bean bags at the front and a L shaped bench with wooden table at the back where we enjoyed breakfast and afternoon tea each day and one lunch & one dinner@ all local food and most enjoyable. You enter the bedroom with marble floors through a glass door and a large comfy bed with full mosquito nets. The bathroom  runs full length behind & consists of firstly a wardrobe with safe & a well stocked mini bar to your left. Then to the right, twin round sinks and then a toilet tucked around further and a large walk in shower with large rose with a fern bed opposite under some sky lights.
All the staff were very polite, friendly & helpful and the owners came around every day to chat & ensure we were enjoying our stay which was a lovely personal touch.
Nick & Rainee
title: 4.00 pm Tea Time on our terrace

text:
We had the most wonderful stay! This place is a gem and we all felt like we were living in paradise.  The staff is so friendly and makes a point to greet you by name. Putu was our main hostess (assisted by Dewi, Tara, Yopi and several others). They did a fabulous job of assisting us in every way we needed, arranging meals, massages, sending out and delivering our laundry, etc.  The owners of the villa also stopped by to make sure we were having a great stay and to be sure all the prepartaions for our cooked on site New Years Eve dinner were taken care of.  They really pay attention and care about every detail. The food, presentation and ambiance were all wonderful!  

  The rooms and bathrooms are all equally gorgeous. There was need to argue about who got what suite because they were all comprable which is important when you are splitting the cost among 4 families.  

The best part is the pool!  Our family was always in it.  The water temperature was perfect, there is a large shelf area  to sit on an enjoy a cocktail. 

We booked directly through the hotel and had breakfast and afternoon tea included in our stay.  Each adult and teen  received a complimenarty 30 min massage, but Yuli has such great hands, we all booked additional time with her. We also had access to the bikes and used them several times. It may seem a bit of a maze at first to find your way to town and the beach, but you catch on quick and it is easy to walk or bike. 

Without any reservations, I recommend the Karmagali!
title: Pure Bliss

text:
My partner and I stayed at Karmagali for our final four nights in Bali and had the most wonderful time!

We arrived from Ubud just before check-in and we very kindly allowed in our room earlier. We were treated to a fresh juice and some delicious pastries while we were getting settled. We stayed in the Timor suite which was perfect for us. No noise from the road but the neighbouring property was a little loud at times - nothing to stress over though!

We were treated to an hour massage (which was definitely the winner for the whole trip) and ended up going back for more during our stay - so handy to have the spa on site and very reasonably priced as well.

Breakfast every morning was delicious - there is plenty to choose from and often I couldn't finish my meal because there was so much food! We had lunch at Karmagali a couple of times and while there wasn't as many vegetarian options to choose from, it was still nice food.

The pool was lovely! The temperature was always perfect and was always kept clean. We used our downtime to have a dip or to lie on our private outdoor lounge chairs to read and just relax with poolside views.

Although not beachside, like many of the other accommodation in Sanur, it's only a 10-15 minute walk to the beach/main road where you will find restaurants, massage spas and shops galore. 

Our favourite part of Karmagali - aside from the wonderful staff, who were always so friendly, helpful and really went out of their way to treat you like family or a good friend - was the resident kitty cat, Mislee! As cat lovers, we think she makes a purr-fect addition to Karmagali and loved her presence, even if she was a loud complainer at times - haha!. There is a huge stray cat problem in Bali so to see Karmagali give Mislee a home and look after her so well was just wonderful and we think other places should have their own resident cat too! Even if you're not a cat lover, don't worry, Mislee will keep her distance and make sure you enjoy your time here. 

Thank you to Karmagali for such a wonderful stay - we hope to be back one day soon!

Sarah and Cam
title: A wonderful time at Karmagali!

text:
Just returned from a five night stay at Karmagali and we already want to return. There is nothing we could think to improve our stay and any of the negatives we had read in previous Trip Advisor reviews turned out to be completely untrue!!
It is situated around 5-10 mins walk from the main street and around 15 mins from the nearest beach. 
The road the complex is on is actually pretty quiet with the occasional motorbike during the night. It is certainly not a busy road and I can’t imagine how anyone would struggle to sleep there.
The food provided is lovely and although you have to order it in advance, this is surely a good thing as it guarantees freshness. The breakfasts are great and complimentary afternoon tea every day!
The staff are amazing and always try to make sure you have everything you need and are willing to make reservations and organise transport for you. 
There are two double sun beds for the property, and although this isn’t enough for one per room, we never struggled to get a bed and we spent the majority of our time on them. 
Overall, this is the perfect place to stay in Sanur and could not recommend it enough.
title: Can’t wait to stay again!

text:
To be welcomed at Karmagali after a cold, long, dark winter in Sweden was like a dream. The staff were fantastic and made sure that we, as their guests, were having a great time in every way. 

We stayed 2 adults and 2 teenagers in the main house with two separate rooms, which were very clean and spacious. Add two bathrooms and a shared living room /kitchen. Every morning a delicious breakfast was served at our own dining table and a daily complimentary tea time at 4 in the sofa. Such luxury! 

We read some negative reviews that complained about noise (from neighbour hood children, dogs cocks, cars, honking) and we can understand what they mean, but at the same time we thought that the hotel's location in the middle of an ongoing Balinese everyday life was lovely.

A good hotel can always be found, but a stay at Karmagali is so much more than that. The staff were fantastic and made sure we had a great time. Nothing was too big to ask for and when our son got some problem with the stomach they tried hard to help him with a quickly recover. 

We rarely go back to a destination twice, but this time the whole family agreed that we would like to return to Karmagali for another holiday. That is a very good score from two teenagers who were referred to hang with their parents for 10 days.

To Putu, Angga, Deli, Frédéric and the rest of the staff we had the pleasure to meet...THANK YOU for a great vacation! Suksma
title: Vacation at its best

Dear Sean,
I'm sorry that Karmagali didn't match your expectations. Maybe you expect for a countryside resort but you booked for a boutique hotel in the heart of the city...

I know that the website is well done (my wife made it) but photos, videos and map cannot lie and our guests use to say that our picture are realistic.

I'm sorry that you didn't wait for a massage cause our therapist is one of the best but its difficult to put you in the schedule if you're staying less than 20 hours in our place.

Only 2 double sun beds... on the pool deck! Each terrasse is equipped with 2 bean beds that can be moved all around the swimming pool if you order for.

Food have to be ordered in front (before 6PM for the same day not 24h) cause in Karmagali everything is home processed from A to Z... Slow and good this how the things are going.

Once again Karmagali is a cozy place and that's why people like it...or not.

Anyway I hope that you enjoyed your holidays in Sanur.

Kind regards
Frederic

text:
My girlfriend and I traveled to Bali in the middle of June and stayed 4 nights in the villa fit for 2, closest to the office. We're both 30 year-old Filipino-Americans from the Bay Area, California, just for a little more insight. 

We absolutely LOVED this place. Out of the other two hotels we stayed in during our trip (budget-boutique hotel in Ubud and ultra resort in Legian), Karmagali Boutique Suites was, by a huge margin, our favorite! The grounds are shared, yet privacy was smart and tasteful, using a blend of landscaping, drapes and strategic unit positioning. The rooms themselves were also beautiful and clean. To us, it combined the best balance of a private and relaxed atmosphere and was situated in a quiet street, while the main part of town a mere 5-10ish minute walk away.

The complimentary breakfast was also incredible. You can tell that they carefully select their fruits because of the sheer flavor, while other establishments that we've visited were surprisingly much more bland. We also opted for the continental and french breakfast option every morning that we never got tired of. And to top it off, the fresh jams, fresh juice and cappuccino helped perfect the entire meal. Sitting in the private patio during breakfast and peering out into the pool and landscape provided the most serene, experience we've had our entire trip. It was really the perfect getaway that we needed from the Bay Area grind.

Now for the staff. Big shout out to Aanga (sp?) and the supporting staff, who went above and beyond with our each and every need. We accidentally left our passports in the room and Aanga drove all the way to Legian to drop them off! Frederick and Magali (owners) were also incredibly welcoming, greeting and taking the time to speak to each and every tenant in the morning. To note, it's an incredible combination to offer both trustworthy local (from the house staff) and expat (Magali and Frederick) perspectives to help ensure that you can choose which recommendation or activity that would best suit you. Moreover, travel can be arranged, complimentary bikes are provided (although we didn't get to use them due to rain), and we never felt pressured.

Overall, do yourselves a favor and stay here for your home base to explore the southern region of Bali, especially if you plan on doing a day trip to Nusa Lembongan (bummer we didn't get to visit due to unpredictable rains and my girlfriend getting sick). We already miss it so much!
title: Incredible stay at Karmagali!

text:
Firstly a big thank you to Frederic & Magali for providing the most beautiful accommodation based just a short stroll from the main shops, restaurants & a little further to the beach. 
Arrived around 11:30 at night, after pre-organising transport with Frederic to be picked up from the airport. Our driver was there waiting for us as scheduled.

As soon as we arrived we were made to feel welcome. There was someone waiting for us to let us into our room & so we could rest for the night.

Putu & Angaa were always helpful & accommodating with any request we had or any information we required. They are the loveliest people. 
In saying that, all staff were friendly & helpful & you could not ask anymore of them as guests of Karmagali.

We stayed in the Timor suite. It was exactly as pictured. Very relaxing. 
Karmagali is quiet, so if you're looking to relax then look no further. The pool was a cool temprature which was refreshing.

The food was always delicious & reasonably priced.

My only two observations (not complaints) was we found the bed to be a bit firm for my wife & I. We use a very soft mattress at home but understand that you can't accommodate everyone's liking there. Also, the food was delicious but a little on the smaller side (I do like a hearty meal).

I still give Karmagali 5 stars & would highly recommend this place to anyone who requires a more relaxing time or to be away from the hussle & bussle.

text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our three nights stay in the Timor Suite. The villas are immaculate and look exactly like they do in the photos. The owners, staff and even their pet cat really go out of their way to make our stay that extra bit special. Breakfasts on the terrace were really good too, fantastic fruit platter. 

As we booked through their website we were given complimentary 30mins massages which were so relaxing and one of the best in the area. 

We would definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a place to unwind and chill. Some very minor comments; the Timor Suite backs onto some local residences and some mornings we were woken up by some loud conversations and babies crying; however don’t let this deter you as it wasn’t much of an issue for us as it added ambience to our wonderful stay. 

Will return hopefully very soon and try out the suites on the other side of the pool. 

Thank you to all at Karmagali. Cheers!

text:
I went wandering around Sanur, as per usual, and found Karmagali Spa within Karmagali Suites.

I have a tradition in Bali to have a massage a day during my stay. It’s fair to say I’m familiar with most of the Spas in Sanur.

The massage therapist was great at Karmagali Spa. She was petite but had a lot of strength behind her. She found the knots in my back and gave them a run for their money without being uncomfortable. I booked a second massage because I thought she was great. 

My reasons for 4 instead of 5/5:

- I felt their massage was overpriced compared to the ‘spa’ facility they provide. 

- it didn’t appear that the linen was changed in between massages. I believe I was the last massage for the day, and the first for the next; even so, I feel they should’ve been changed.
title: Karmagali Spa

owner_response.text:
Dear Raelene,
Thank you for this review. You can be sure that Karmagali’s spa is using the same sanitary standard than our Boutique Hotel:
- Linen is changed between massages.
- Our complete customized bodycare line is 100% natural and organic; Massage oil is a mix of virgin coconut oil, almond oil and essential oil for the fragrance... No chemicals, no paraben and no sulfite.
- For manucure and pedicure instruments we are using UV sterilization.
- La « petite » Yuli is our resident therapist, its mean that every customer will got the same quality of massage that you had.
We are really pleased that you appreciated your massage and we hope that all those details will move your 4 into a 5.
Kind regards 
Frédéric, owner/manager of Karmagali Boutique Suites

text:
Third stop in our two weeks Bali vacation. Coming from Lovina, we were warmly welcomed by the french owners/hosts, and the friendly staff at Karmagali. 
It´s a nicely secluded place sitting centrally in Sanur. The walls and the buildings shuts the outside noise out, when you´re outside the room. Outside noise actually more audible from inside the room, so you will hear everyday life from the families living and the school next door. 

Nicely decorated rooms with efficient, light proof curtains and powerful/silent cooling, able to make dark and chilli nights in the room. At least as long as you keep the bathroom door shut. Lighting makes it somewhat dark and "dungeon-like".  
The suite has a quite private outdoor living space. Well shaded, nice place to sit and relax. It is also here the breakfast is served. Breakfast is great, with multiple options.

Bungalows are designed with the bathroom in back of the sleeping room. This is no open or semi open bathroom. Bathroom is a beautiful and closed room. Light is electric and through has a couple of covered, rectangular light holes in the roof. It feels moist and damp, with the plants by the shower adding to this feeling. After showering, it feels like the door to the sleeping rom is the main "ventilation". Can this be good in the long run? I would consider installing some kind of mechanical ventilation in one of the light holes to dry it up, and perhaps replacing the plants and soil with some less moist adding decoration. 

We enjoyed staying at Karmagali, so much we considered asking to come back when we discovered what a crazy plaze Seminyak is (our two last nights). 

Karmagli´s massage therapist is a girl small by size, with huge skills, powerful hands and the biggest smile you can imagine. 

Likes: 
Outdoor, private living space
Breakfast
Hosts and staff

Suggestions for improvement: 
Concerned about bathroom, feels moist and damp with insufficient ventilation
Beds are good, pillows uncomfortable.
Wifi could do with better bandwith.
title: Nice staff, decor and breakfast

owner_response.text:
Thanks a lot Jorn,
As you know we care about our guest’s suggestion specially with professional one...
We already move the traditional «halang» ceiling to a gypsum one in our first room.
It’s bring noise insulation and brightness inside the room. For bath we will improve ventilation but you have to know that humidity feeling is normal when come out of the climatised room (that is really dry and cold) to bathroom that is not climatised... People usually love our inside tropical garden.... For wifi we changed antenna with a new 2x11 Dbi one that using 802.11n/g/b standard on 2,4G band up to 300Mbs.
Now you just have to come back and check it by yourself ;)) ...maybe with your sons?
Kind regards
Frédéric

We stayed the final two nights of our Bali trip in the Karmagali Suites Hotel. The hotel is in the middle of Sanur, in a very quiet sidestreet. The staff was really friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and the breakfast amazing. They served one of the best crepes we ever had! 

The owners are really helpful in planing trips, renting a scooter or finding a good restaurant for dinner. As they only have 5 suites the whole hotel experience felt very personal. You always have the attention of the friendly staff.

Because our flight was scheduled during the night, we also could use a special bathroom for late checkout guest. This is so handy if you have to depart during the afternoon or night.

It was a very pleasant experience and we will come back anytime.
title: Awesome, personal, quiet hotel in Sanur

text:
We stayed at Karmagali Suites for 5 days two weeks ago in the Ram and Sita Suite, which was lovely. It was extremely clean and the bathroom is very spacious, with good lighting. All the rooms look out to a garden space with the pool in the middle of the complex. 

Karmagali is about a ten minute walk to the main street where there are plenty of bars and restaurants. It is in a relatively quiet location. 

Frederic, Margali and their staff impressed us with their very efficient and friendly service. Breakfast is varied and cooked to order. We really enjoyed the home made pastries and the refreshing chilled ginger drink. 

If you are going to Sanur then this is definitely the place to stay. We look forward to returning here again.
title: A luxurious haven

text: Fred and Magali are the best hosts! The staff is so kind, and focused on you being comfortable. The hotel area is clean and nice. You need to go here, if you are in Sanur. If you are looking for a quite paradise to ralax, and enjoy the sun and the NICE pool, this is the place!!!

text:
Das kleine Hotel liegt in einer ruhigen Seitenstraße von Sanur, nur ein paar Minuten vom Strand und der Hauptstraße mit vielen Restaurants, Bars und Einkaufsmöglichkeiten entfernt.
Die Zimmer sind um den Pool angeordnet und sehr geräumig und sauber. Das Personal war sehr zuvorkommend, freundlich und darum bemüht, den Aufenthalt für uns so entspannt wie möglich zu gestalten.
Das Frühstück wurde für jede Wohneinheit separat serviert - es gab also kein Buffet. Aber man konnte sich sein Frühstück so zusammenstellen, wie man es mag und am Abend für den nächsten Tag vorbestellen.
Wir haben zwei Touren direkt über das Hotel gebucht. Das ist durchaus empfehlenswert. Die Autos waren in einem guten Zustand und die Fahrer sicher unterwegs. Außerdem blieben uns die lästigen Stopps bei den zahlreichen "Fabrikverkäufen" erspart.
Was sicher auch noch erwähnenswert ist: das Hotel versucht möglichst wenig Verpackungsmüll zu erzeugen. Das Wasser in den Zimmern wurde in Glaskaraffen bereitgestellt,  keine Plastikverpakungen für Marmeladen, Butter etc.
title: Eine kleine Oase in zentraler Lage von Sanur

text:
